text:
Welcome to the Doohickey Series 300 Communicator!
This is a quick tour of the ui.
Click anything to proceed.
This is the main display. It shows info about the frequency you are currently on. The bottom 4 rows act as the input field to type your message. More about input later.
Here is the frequency adjustment dial. You can interact with it by dragging it. It snaps to the 800 available channels.
This box is just a visual thing that moves with the frequency dial.
Up here is the power switch. It's function is pretty self explanatory. It is on by default for convenience.
These are the popups. They can display error, warnings, or info. They pop up when active. Hover over to see the message.
This is the printer. All the messages you receive will be printed out from here.
Almost done! This is the keyboard. You can use it to write or use your devices built-in keyboard that is synchronised to this one.

You can type out your messages here. Basic markdown syntax is supported:

# Headers, *italics*, **bolding**

, Lists, links and images work too.

Last but not least: the function keys.
The SEND key broadcasts your message to the current channel. The ENTER key just creates a line break in your message.

Now you are free to play around. Here is a list of channels that have content in them:
  • 300: The echo chamber
